title: Michelin - worldwide number of employees by region 2018
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of employees in each Region on the y axis.
The Number of employees is highest at Region Europe and lowest at Region Africa India Middle-East.
There is a difference of 68751.0 between the maximum Region Europe and minimum Region Africa India Middle-East.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of employees in each Region on the y axis.
Region Europe has the highest Number of employees and Africa India Middle-East has the lowest Number of employees.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of employees in each Region on the y axis.
The Number of employees is highest at Region Europe and lowest at Region Africa India Middle-East.

max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of employees for 5 number of Regions.
Region Europe has the highest Number of employees and Africa India Middle-East has the lowest Number of employees.
Region North America has the second highest value for Number of employees.
The Number of employees of Region Africa India Middle-East is 38.2% smaller than the maximum value at Europe.
The Region Europe has the highest Number of employees, followed by North America, and Asia (excl. India). Down to the Region Africa India Middle-East which is the lowest.
The Region Europe has 3.01 times more Number of employees than average.
